intro: Pilosella bauhini var. laconicum, commonly known as the slender leaf pearlyweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered with fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months.
